laboratory_examinations.findings: Dramatic improvement noted within 2 weeks on the treated hand; no pain or palmar swelling after immersion in water.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Untreated hand remained affected. Symptoms recurred on discontinuation of treatment but resolved completely after 3 months of intermittent use.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Partial response with occasional use; fewer exacerbations noted while maintained on topical therapy.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Symptoms improved with the use of aluminum chloride; recurred when the treatment was discontinued.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Controlled within 2 weeks using aluminum chloride.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Rechallenge with water immersion demonstrated no recurrence of symptoms as long as treatment continued.
